intro: Caricteria, commonly known as the "false thistle," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species native to various regions of Europe, Asia, and North Africa. The plants typically have upright stems and are characterized by their spiny leaves and composite flower heads. They are often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Caricteria species are generally herbaceous and can be either annual or perennial depending on the species.
